required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the GORE® PI 13-05 Device for the Treatment of Occlusive Disease in the Common and External Iliac Arteries
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Evaluation of the GORE® PI 13-05 Device for the Treatment of Occlusive Disease in the Common and External Iliac Arteries

oversight_info.authority: New Zealand: Health and Disability Ethics Committees

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the GORE® PI-13-05 clinical study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of PI 13-05 for the treatment of arterial occlusive disease in patients with de novo or restenotic lesions in the common and/or external iliac arteries.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Composite safety endpoint measured as a percentage,tallying all subjects experiencing any of the events as a failure
